column4: I'm installing ubuntu linux right now and it's taking a really, really long time, 3 hours so far. I don't think it should take this long, I have an Athlon 2600+
can anyone help me speed it up?
at the second stage, the CD is already out
it's doing all the package unpacking, it goes in little spurts
they're all local, nothing is being downloaded
this is the second time the install is running, I'm trying a different filesystem, but nothing is different
the first time I stopped it after 1.5 hours, I said OK to download updates from the net. This time I did not
yes, it's a 7200 RPM drive, seagate. i386
just had a seagate drive die on my like yesterday
ran the smart tests in windows, predicted failure
I've had it for over a year, my windows XP runs off the same drive
probly have better luck than me :)
where did you run those tests?
where? in windows, there is one for windows (not bootable floppy)
I'm gonna stop it and try it out
I'm just booting into windows to try this out....maybe it is the damn drive
